jsx.ui
Class Widget

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source
              jsx.ui.Widget
Direct Known Subclasses:
Box, Canvas, CanvasDraw, Component, Control, Draggable, Effects, Graphic, Mouse, ProgressBar, Pseudo, Toggle, Tree
public class Widget
extends Source

A base class for graphical widgets.

A Widget is either a Component or a wrapper that wraps a Component to encapsulate additional functionalities.

Note that, widgets are Configurable and event sources which fire Widget.Event.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Nested Class Summary
static class Widget.Event<T>
          An abstract base class for high level events to be fired from widgets.

Field Detail

COMPONENT

protected static final Id<Component> COMPONENT

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Widget.

The identified configurable property of a Widget is a reference to the component wrapped by this widget.

Since:
1.0

ACTIVE

protected static final Id<Pseudo> ACTIVE

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Widget.

The identified configurable property of a Widget is a reference to the Pseudo object associated with the underlying component wrapped by this widget.

The property stores a Pseudo object for "active" pseudo-selector.

Since:
1.0

FOCUS

protected static final Id<Pseudo> FOCUS

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Widget.

The identified configurable property of a Widget is a reference to the Pseudo object associated with the underlying component wrapped by this widget.

The property stores a Pseudo object for "focus" pseudo-selector.

Since:
1.0

PREVENTEVENT

protected static final Id<java.lang.Boolean> PREVENTEVENT

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Widget.

The identified configurable property of a Widget is a reference to a boolean value associated with the underlying component wrapped by this widget.

The property indicates whether the widget prevents events.

Since:
1.0

PREVENTCLICK

protected static final Id<java.lang.Boolean> PREVENTCLICK

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Widget.

The identified configurable property of a Widget is a reference to a boolean value associated with the underlying component wrapped by this widget.

The property indicates whether the widget prevents click events.

Since:
1.0
Constructor Detail

Widget

protected Widget(ObjectLike ini)

A typical constructor forcing constructors of subclasses to pass an initializing object as argument.

This constructor simply invokes the typical constructor of the superclass passing the specified initializing object as the argument.

Note that, this constructor sets the configurable property COMPONENT of this widget to a newly created component which wraps a JsHTMLDivElement if the property is still undefined.

Parameters:
ini - The initializing object.
Since:
1.0

Widget

public Widget(Component e)

A typical constructor forcing constructors of subclasses to pass initializing data.

This constructor simply invokes the typical constructor of the superclass passing the specified initializing object as the argument.

Note that, this constructor sets the configurable property COMPONENT of this widget to the argument component.

Parameters:
e - The underlying component.
Since:
1.0
Method Detail

toString

public java.lang.String toString()

Returns the string representation of the component.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
The string representation of the component.
Since:
1.0

unwrap

public final Component unwrap()

Returns the wrapped component.

The event queuing and dispatching mechanism in the superclass Source.Event tries to dispatch an event fired from a widget also to its wrapped component by calling this method, if this widget does wrap another valid source.

This method simply returns the configurable property COMPONENT of this wrapper widget.

Specified by:
unwrap in class Source
Returns:
The wrapped component.
Since:
1.0

addClasses

protected final void addClasses()

Adds CSS class names to the underlying HTML element.

Since:
1.0

getParent

public Component getParent()

Returns the container source object if this one is graphically contained by another widget.

The wrapped object of a widget must also be a widget.

The event queuing and dispatching mechanism of the superclass tries to dispatch an event fired from a widget also to its container by calling this method, if this source is graphically contained by another valid source and the event wants to bubble, that is, its Source.Event.BUBBLE configurable property is true.

Specified by:
getParent in class Source
Returns:
The widget graphically containing this widget.
Since:
1.0

isParentOf

public final boolean isParentOf(Widget w)

Determines if the widget is the parent of another widget.

This method simply checks if the wrapped component contains that of the other widget.

Parameters:
w - Another widget.
Returns:
true if the widget contains the other; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0

isRendered

public final boolean isRendered()

Determines if the widget has been rendered.

This method simply checks if the wrapped component has wrapped an HTML element.

Returns:
true if the widget is rendered; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0

attachEvent

protected final Handle attachEvent(java.lang.String bevt,
                                   Widget.Event<?> evt,
                                   Id<java.lang.Boolean> pid)

Associates a type of high level event to a browser event of the underly HTML element.

This method creates, attaches and returns a Handle. To destroy the association, simply detach the returned Handle by calling Handle.detach().

Parameters:
bevt - The name of a browser event.
evt - A high level widget event.
pid - A Id of a property that tells whether prevents any events.
Returns:
The newly created Handle.
Since:
1.0

attachEvent

protected final Handle attachEvent(Component e,
                                   java.lang.String bevt,
                                   Widget.Event<?> evt,
                                   Id<java.lang.Boolean> pid)

Associates a type of high level event to a browser event of the given component.

This method creates, attaches and returns a Handle. To destroy the association, simply detach the returned Handle by calling Handle.detach().

Parameters:
e - A component that fires the browser event.
bevt - The name of a browser event.
evt - A high level widget event.
pid - A Id of a property that tells whether prevents any events.
Returns:
The newly created Handle.
Since:
1.0

                                   Widget.Event<?> evt)

Associates a type of high level event to a browser event of the underly HTML element.

This method creates, attaches and returns a Handle. To destroy the association, simply detach the returned Handle by calling Handle.detach().

Parameters:
bevt - The name of a browser event.
evt - A high level widget event.
Returns:
The newly created Handle.
